note_tutorial_1: You made it this far. That's fantastic! I can't tell you how badly I need you to keep going.
note_tutorial_2: Full disclosure: these are optional collectibles. Unfortunately they're my only avenue of direct communication.
note_tutorial_3:
Yes, you will probably skip these. Yes, it will break my heart.

But I'll make sure to say all the really important things at the end.
note_level1_1:
Why am I giving the matchmaking system a face and personality?

I don't know. Making her makes me feel better.
note_level1_2:
Penelope most likely adores you already, but she'll try to hide it. I'm giving her a healthy dose of self-respect.

Everyone needs that, right? Even chat bots.
note_level1_3: If you beat this level, you'll probably be in the top 50% or so of players. Sad, isn't it?
note_level2_1: I know she can be annoying, but be nice to Penelope, okay? She's fragile.
note_level2_2:
The whole world is incredibly fragile. As I write this, I'm still creating it.

Anything could change at a moment's notice. Or I could finally give up.

But if you're reading this, I didn't give up.
note_level2_3:
This level started out completely different. I trashed it months ago, then today I resurrected it out of source control and gave it a face-lift.

You are literally playing in garbage.
note_level3_1: This level sucks. I'm sorry. I spent weeks on it and it still sucks.
note_level3_2:
I wish Penelope would like me. I could make her like me, but what's the point?

Regardless, she'll hate me soon enough. And so will you.
note_level3_3: I'm not sure if Penelope even knows I exist. I think she's only vaguely aware at this point.
